qti-assessment-item.title: Equivalent Ratios on a Double Number Line

qti-item-body.p: Cory hikes up a hill with a constant slope. The double number line shows that after Cory hikes 3 km, their elevation is 120 m.

qti-content-body.p: Correct! The ratio of distance to elevation is 3:120, which simplifies to a unit rate of 1:40. For every 1 km hiked, the elevation increases by 40 m. This matches the correct number line.
Not quite. First, find the unit rate. If Cory's elevation is 120 m after 3 km, the rate is 120 m3 km=40 meters per kilometer. Use this rate to fill in the other values on the number line.
